heisig_story: The pictograph of two swinging gates is so clear in this kanji that only its stroke order needs to be memorized. In case you should have any trouble, though, you might doodle with the shapes on a piece of paper, taking care to note the difference in the stroke order of the two facing doors. The gates usually serve as an enclosure, and are written BEFORE whatever it is they enclose.
koohiiStory1: HeisigÂ´s stroke order in the 4th edition (and earlier) is wrong, so be careful -- first is the left-most vertical stroke, then draw the rest of the "sun" attachment as you would normally. In fact, if you just wrote it out as two suns with elongated sides, youÂ´ll get the stroke order exactly correct.
koohiiStory2: The gates to Hell. guarded by Cerebus or ... Bill Gates?

WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You're standing in front of some gates. You can't get through them, but on the other side you hear all kinds of loud moans (ã‚‚ã‚“). Are those zombie noises? Is this gate to keep the zombies out, or in?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: They start pounding on the gate, and it begins to budge. Focus in on their moaning noises, because that's the reading of this kanji, but also feel the fear as well. When you start moaning too, it seems to calm them. Go ahead and pretend you're in front of this gate, and moan out loud for me a bit. Uwhhhhhh. Muhehwhhhhhhh.

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Pictograph of a gate or door.
origin_of_ch_char_book: Not many people could afford wooden doors. Only high class government officials and upper class aristocratic people could afford doors on their houses. (é–€, é—¨, men, door, gate) shows a two-leaf door in front of a big house.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions on oracle bones are made of two doors, and oracle bone inscriptions may be added with a door lintel. The characters of the Warring States Period are inherited from the characters of Shang and Zhou Dynasties, or add two strokes in the " men " as decoration. "Said Wen": "Door, Wen Ye, from Erhu, pictogram. All members of the door follow the door." Press " Wen " to explain " door " as the sound instruction. The phonetic analogy relationship between " door " and " wen ", " house " and " protection " was cited by Hu Pu'an as an example of what he called "transfer tone".

Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to the door. The oracle bones often use the " gate " as the gate of the ancestral temple. Collection 32035: "Wang Yuzongmen rebelled against the Qiang" refers to the generals who received captives from the Qiang at the gate of the ancestral temple. Or it can be used as the gate of the hall, "Compilation" 30285: "Yu Tingmen [äº¯ä¸®]é…“" refers to the two kinds of ceremonies held at the hall gate [äº¯ä¸®] and é…“. Also used as a place name.

Bronze " door " is used as the original meaning and refers to door. Ge Bai ğ£ª•: "Shedong Gate" means passing through the East Gate. Also used as a verb, referring to attacking the city gate. Geng Hu: "The gate of Geng." Yang Shuda: "Those who have the gate of Geng are also attacking the gate. According to "Zuo Zhuan. Twenty-eight years of Gong Xi", it says: "Jin Hou encircles Cao, the gate Yan, many die." Du Note: "Attack the gate of Cao City." Also in "Zuo Zhuan. Two Years of Chenggong" said: "Qi Hou defeated me in the north, surrounded the dragon, and Lu Pu, a man of Heng Gong, was at the Kuimen Yan." Du Note: " Attack the dragon gate too."...The city gates of the besieged towns must be attacked. The gates are also called gates. Ancient grammatical names often have the same effect." Pressing " gate " as a verb can also be interpreted as guarding the gate, "Guang Ya" . Interpretation III: "Door, Shouya." "Zuo Zhuan. "Fifteen Years of Wengong": "One person at Juqiu, one person at Shuqiu, and all die." Du's note: "If there are bandits attacking the door, the second son will die."

The " door " in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is used as the original meaning and refers to the door. "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. Confucius Poetry Brief 4: "The Poem is not (its) Youping (Ping) Gate", which means that the Poem is like a flat gate (Ji Xusheng). Also used as a place name, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rongchengshi" Jane 40: "Soup may attack it, descend from Mingyou (tiao), cut the gate of Gaoshen, Jie (Jie) is the south of escape ğ¦¾ˆ (Nest) is (Shi)." Zhitang attacked him again, and went down the mountain stream passage of Mingtiao to crusade against the gate of the high god, and Jie had to escape to the south nest.

The " door " in the handed down literature refers to the doorway and the key meaning from the door. "easy. "Xi Ci": "The universe, its easy door is evil." Kong Yingdashu: "The change of Yi starts from the universe, and the excitement of the people comes out of the door, so the universe is the door of easy evil."

" Gate " can also refer to the meanings of family and category. Such as "Lun Heng. "Ask Confucius": "All the critics say: Confucius's seventy sons are better than modern Confucianists." "Book of the Later Han." "The Legend of Rulin": "Tu is divided into different streams, specializing and prospering." Modern Chinese still has idioms such as categorized, five-flowered, and hundred-class.

    Heisig: The pictograph of two swinging gates is so clear in this kanji that only its stroke order needs to be memorized. In case you should have any trouble, though, you might doodle with the shapes on a piece of paper, taking care to note the difference in the stroke order of the two facing doors. The gates usually serve as an enclosure, and are written BEFORE whatever it is they enclose.

    Inscriptions on oracle bones are made of two doors, and oracle bone inscriptions may be added with a door lintel. The characters of the Warring States Period are inherited from the characters of Shang and Zhou Dynasties, or add two strokes in the " men" as decoration. "Said Wen": "Door, Wen Ye, from Erhu, pictogram. All members of the door follow the door." Press " Wen" to explain " door" as the sound instruction. The phonetic analogy relationship between " door" and " wen", " house" and " protection" was cited by Hu Pu'an as an example of what he called "transfer tone". Oracle is used as the original meaning, referring to the door. The oracle bones often use the " gate" as the gate of the ancestral temple. Collection 32035: "Wang Yuzongmen rebelled against the Qiang" refers to the generals who received captives from the Qiang at the gate of the ancestral temple. Or it can be used as the gate of the hall, "Compilation" 30285: "Yu Tingmen [äº¯ä¸®]é…“" refers to the two kinds of ceremonies held at the hall gate [äº¯ä¸®] and é…“. Also used as a place name. Bronze " door" is used as the original meaning and refers to door. Ge Bai ğ£ª•: "Shedong Gate" means passing through the East Gate. Also used as a verb, referring to attacking the city gate. Geng Hu: "The gate of Geng." Yang Shuda: "Those who have the gate of Geng are also attacking the gate. According to "Zuo Zhuan. Twenty-eight years of Gong Xi", it says: "Jin Hou encircles Cao, the gate Yan, many die." Du Note: "Attack the gate of Cao City." Also in "Zuo Zhuan. Two Years of Chenggong" said: "Qi Hou defeated me in the north, surrounded the dragon, and Lu Pu, a man of Heng Gong, was at the Kuimen Yan." Du Note: " Attack the dragon gate too."...The city gates of the besieged towns must be attacked. The gates are also called gates. Ancient grammatical names often have the same effect." Pressing " gate" as a verb can also be interpreted as guarding the gate, "Guang Ya" . Interpretation III: "Door, Shouya." "Zuo Zhuan. "Fifteen Years of Wengong": "One person at Juqiu, one person at Shuqiu, and all die." Du's note: "If there are bandits attacking the door, the second son will die." The " door" in the bamboo slips of the Warring States period is used as the original meaning and refers to the door. "Shangbo Bamboo Book One. Confucius Poetry Brief 4: "The Poem is not (its) Youping (Ping) Gate", which means that the Poem is like a flat gate (Ji Xusheng). Also used as a place name, "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rongchengshi" Jane 40: "Soup may attack it, descend from Mingyou (tiao), cut the gate of Gaoshen, Jie (Jie) is the south of escape ğ¦¾ˆ (Nest) is (Shi)." Zhitang attacked him again, and went down the mountain stream passage of Mingtiao to crusade against the gate of the high god, and Jie had to escape to the south nest. The " door" in the handed down literature refers to the doorway and the key meaning from the door. "easy. "Xi Ci": "The universe, its easy door is evil." Kong Yingdashu: "The change of Yi starts from the universe, and the excitement of the people comes out of the door, so the universe is the door of easy evil." " Gate" can also refer to the meanings of family and category. Such as "Lun Heng. "Ask Confucius": "All the critics say: Confucius's seventy sons are better than modern Confucianists." "Book of the Later Han." "The Legend of Rulin": "Tu is divided into different streams, specializing and prospering." Modern Chinese still has idioms such as categorized, five-flowered, and hundred-class.

    ["Guangyun" Mo Benqie, Ping Hun, Ming. ]
    Traditional characters for "é—¨1". Also known as "é–…1".
    (1) Barrier devices that can open and close the entrances and exits of houses, fences, vehicles and ships.
    (2) Entrance and exit of houses, fences, vehicles and ships.
    (3) Checkpoints for inspection and tax collection.
    (4) In front of the door, at the door.
    (5) The shape or function is like a door.
    (6) The orifice of the human body.
    (7) Entrance and exit that must be passed by land and water.
    (8) Doorway; trick.
    (9) The starting point of things; the key.
    (10) The home of the doctors of the Western Zhou Dynasty, the Spring and Autumn Period, and the Warring States Period. Later refers to family, family.
    (11) Family position.
    (12) Factions in religious and academic thought.
    (13) Shimen.
    (14) Category.
    (15) Specifically refers to one of the categories used in biological taxonomy.
    (16) Attacking or defending the goal.
    (17) Refers to the gatekeeper.
    (18) Building the portal.
    (19) Ancient sacrificial names.
    (20) The provincial name of Nanmen Star.
    (21) Go terms.
    (22) Quantifiers. Used for guns.
    (23) Quantifiers. Used for subjects, learning, etc.
    (24) Quantifiers. Used for marriage, relatives, etc.
    (25) Quantifiers. Used for payments.
    (26) Auxiliary words. It's still like that.
    (27) Auxiliary words. Suffix, meaningless.

    Radicals: é–€  (gate)
    Meaning Mnemonic
    The radical for gate and the kanji for gates are the same!
    Know your radicals or you won't be allowed to pass.
    Reading Mnemonic
    You're standing in front of some gates. You can't get through them, but on the other side you hear all kinds of loud moans (ã‚‚ã‚“). Are those zombie noises? Is this gate to keep the zombies out, or in?
    They start pounding on the gate, and it begins to budge. Focus in on their moaning noises, because that's the reading of this kanji, but also feel the fear as well. When you start moaning too, it seems to calm them. Go ahead and pretend you're in front of this gate, and moan out loud for me a bit. Uwhhhhhh. Muhehwhhhhhhh.
